intro: Bienertia, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia, particularly in deserts and rocky areas. They are characterized by their low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Bienertia species are often found in sandy soils and are adapted to extreme drought conditions. Their flowers are typically small and pink or white, and they play a role in stabilizing sandy soils in their native habitats.
